      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.awt.Color brighter(java.awt.Color color, double factor)
      Returns a color that is brighter than the argument color by a given factor.
      static double brightness(java.awt.Color color)
      Returns the brightness of the color as a factor between 0 and 1, where 1 is the maximum brightness.
      static java.awt.Color darker(java.awt.Color color, double factor)
      Returns a color that is darker than the argument color by a given factor.
      static double darkness(java.awt.Color color)
      Returns the darkness of the color as a factor between 0 and 1, where 1 is the maximum darkness.
      static java.awt.Color getColor(java.lang.String hexString)
      Convert an hex string with the format FFFF:FFFF:FFFF (POI) into a color.

    • Method Detail

      • darkness

        public static double darkness(java.awt.Color color)
        Returns the darkness of the color as a factor between 0 and 1, where 1 is the maximum darkness.
        Parameters:
        color - The check color.
        Returns:
        The darkness.

      • brightness

        public static double brightness(java.awt.Color color)
        Returns the brightness of the color as a factor between 0 and 1, where 1 is the maximum brightness.
        Parameters:
        color - The check color.
        Returns:
        The brightness.

      • brighter

        public static java.awt.Color brighter(java.awt.Color color,
                                      double factor)
        Returns a color that is brighter than the argument color by a given factor. The factor must be greater than 0 and less than 1, and is stronger as it increases. The color 255 - (red, green and blue) are multiplied by factor.
        Parameters:
        color - The source color.
        factor - The factor.
        Returns:
        The brighter color.

      • darker

        public static java.awt.Color darker(java.awt.Color color,
                                    double factor)
        Returns a color that is darker than the argument color by a given factor. The factor must be greater than 0 and less than 1, and is stronger as it increases. The color red, green and blue are multiplied by (1 - factor).
        Parameters:
        color - The source color.
        factor - The factor.
        Returns:
        The darker color.

      • getColor

        public static java.awt.Color getColor(java.lang.String hexString)
        Convert an hex string with the format FFFF:FFFF:FFFF (POI) into a color.
        Parameters:
        hexString - An hex string with the format FFFF:FFFF:FFFF
        Returns:
        The color.
